basics.name: Srinivasan Dhanaraj
basics.label: Metallurgist
basics.summary: Masters in Metallurgy and Integrated Computational Materials Engineering with more than 10 years of relavent industry experience

work.name: Bharat Forge Ltd, Pune
work.summary: Gained experience in diverse manufacturing processes including heat treatment, plating, coating, and casting (ferrous and non-ferrous).

work.name: Honda Cars R&D (HGID), Gr Noida
work.summary: Focused on new material research for light weighting and optimising metallurgical processes.

work.name: Ford Motor Company, Chennai
work.summary: Part of the International Markets Group as Technical Specialist for Castings, Forgings, Raw Materials.

work.name: The Automotive Research Association of India, Pune
work.summary: Currently working on New Material Research through ICME approach, AI & ML for Materials, Material Infomatics.

awards.title: Asia West Steel Champion
awards.summary: I was tasked to simulate a grade of steel meeting technical requirements at the lowest cost per tonne with carbon footprint requirements.

awards.title: World Steel Champion
awards.summary: Finalist of Regional Champions are invited to compete for the World Championship Titile. I have emerged as World Champion.

certificates.name: Artificial Intellignence and Machine Learning of Materials

recommendations.name: Shridhar Naik
recommendations.reference: Srini is knowledgeable and very enthusiastic. I came across him as as a person with very positive attitude and he was better than seniors on many things. I wish him a successful journey.

recommendations.name: K Mounika
recommendations.reference: Benefitting greatly from Srinivasan's mentorship, I have acquired substantial knowledge. He has extensive expertise in Thermodynamics and Steel Making, coupled with exceptional leadership skills. As my mentor and advisor for the Steel Challenge '18, his guidance led me to secure 3rd place in the Asia West region.

Projects.name: Microstructure Modeling of Fe-Cr Phase Seperation
Projects.summary: Research on Mesoscale Modeling on Phase Seperaation of Fe-Cr alloy and Fe-Cr-Co alloy by using NIST Thermodynamic Databases
